conditions.name: Dose Escalation Safety Review
conditions.description: Safety data must be reviewed by the Safety Review Committee before dose escalation.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Moderate Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to liver enzyme elevation.
conditions.text: ALT or AST > 3 x ULN and <= 5 x ULN

conditions.name: Severe Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for permanent discontinuation due to severe liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Significant Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a drop in hemoglobin.

conditions.name: Significant Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a drop in platelets.

conditions.name: Significant Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a drop in neutrophils.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Hy's Law
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to concurrent bilirubin and ALT elevation.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 x ULN

conditions.name: Neurological Worsening
conditions.description: Clinical evidence of neurological worsening requiring evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Clinical evidence of psychiatric worsening requiring evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Discontinuation Events
conditions.description: List of events that require consideration for discontinuation from study intervention.
conditions.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation to 30mg
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, participants will be titrated up to 30 mg/day, following a satisfactory safety review of data through Day 23.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate LFT Elevation
transitionRules.text: Temporarily interrupt dosing if ALT or AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT/AST < 2x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe LFT Elevation
transitionRules.text: Discontinue study intervention if ALT or AST > 5x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Toxicity
transitionRules.text: Reduce dose to previous level (or 15mg QOD if on 15mg QD) if Hemoglobin drops >2 g/dL, or Platelets or Neutrophils drop >30% from baseline.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Hy's Law
transitionRules.text: Temporarily interrupt dosing if Bilirubin > 2x ULN and ALT > 3x ULN. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when bilirubin is below ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Specific Safety Events
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for: Serious hypersensitivity reaction, Severe uncontrolled infection, Use of disallowed medication, or Pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Voluntary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Escalation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to escalate dose from 15mg to 30mg, contingent on SRC safety review of data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Liver Function Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decision-making based on liver function test results to determine if dose interruption or discontinuation is required.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Hematology Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decision-making based on complete blood count results to determine if dose reduction is required.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Clinical Worsening Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decision-making based on clinical assessment of neurologic or psychiatric status to determine if dose modification is required.
